item.title: [317 - Delta] Cooking.java! Cooking Base!
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“SCFTW, post:66, topic:343374”][quote author=matzie link=topic=439768.msg4050806#msg4050806 date=1342490852]
private Cooking cooking = new Cooking();
----------------^
has to be lowercase so the name of your class is not the same as the class your trying to initialize.
[/quote]

It did work without it.[/quote]

eyeownyew:

Apparently it works, although his conventions suck dick

Read full topic

symbol  : constructor Cooking(client)
location: class Cooking

                          ^
client.java:10839: boolean cannot be dereferenced

Is your source packaged? This is for non pakage. I’ve added it before and worked fine.

No, it’s not packaged at all, all of the files are in one folder (Delta)
[/quote]
Do the tutorial again. Check all of the code you’ve added.[/quote]
